On Nov 19, 2010, at 4:18 PM, Eric J. Bowman wrote:

> Zhi-Qiang Lei wrote:=

>> 
>> I want my resource expose its created time or updated time in
>> re=
presentation. But seems to PUT a update means that the value is
>> inputed =
by client. I want it to be assigned by server but client.
>> Does it means =
that I have to use POST? Thanks.
>> 
> 
> No.  The server can do whatever i=
t wants with the PUT, so long as it's
> idempotent.  The user-agent sends a=
 timestamp, the server ignores it
> and uses its own.  Perfectly fine.
> 
>=
 -Eric


Thanks. Sounds good. But if a timestamp appear in representation, =
is it still idempotent?

Best regards,
Zhi-Qiang Lei
zhiqiang.lei@...=
